name: Do You Know Your Sports? Quiz | USA | 15 Questions

questions.text: What Charlotte Hornets player died in a tragic car crash in May, 2000?
questions.explanation:
Bobby Phills.

	Derrick Thomas played football for Kansas City and also died in a car crash like Bobby Phills.

questions.text: What was the name of the Seattle Sonics home court, before they moved to become Oklahoma City Thunder?
questions.explanation:
Key Arena.

	Staples Center is home for the LA Clippers and LA Lakers. The Rose Garden is home to Portland Trail Blazers. Madison Square Gardens is home to New York Knicks.

questions.text: What park is home to the Detroit Tigers?
questions.explanation:
Comerica Park.

	Safeco Field is home to the Mariners, Pacific Bell Park is home to the Giants, and Yankee Stadium is home to well, you know.

questions.text: Which of these colleges was not in the Pac-10, before it became the Pac-12?
questions.explanation:
Colorado.

	Colorado was in the Big 12. The Pac-10 became the Pac-12 in 2011 when Colorado and Utah joined.

questions.text: Which NBA star threw a person through a plate glass window in a bar fight, in October 1997?
questions.explanation:
Charles Barkley.

	Yep it was 'Sir Charles'. He was hit by a glass of ice.

questions.text: Which of these four was the the tallest player to ever play in the NBA?
questions.explanation:
Gheorghe Muresan.

	Manute Bol 7ft 6 13-16ths in. Gheorghe Muearsan 7ft 7in.

questions.text: At a MLB park how far is it from home base to first base?
What is the Seattle Mariners mascot?
questions.explanation:
The Mariner Moose.

	Lenny the Latte and The Mariner aren't even real. Sasquatch is the Sonics mascot.

questions.text: Who picks first in the 2000 NFL Draft?
Who did the Florida Gators defeat to make it to the NCAA National Championship basketball game in 2000?
questions.explanation:
North Carolina.

	Michigan State beat Wisconsin to make it to the National Championship and Michigan State beat Florida to win it all.

questions.text: Which of these got to 400 home runs quicker (i.e. was the youngest)?
questions.explanation:
Ken Griffey Jr.

	Yep, it was 'The Kid' Griffey. He hit it on his father's 50th Birthday.

questions.text: What is Ken Griffey Jr's new number in Cincinnati?
Where will you find baseball's Angels?
When did the Dodgers first become a franchise?
What NBA star is known as 'The Admiral'?
questions.explanation:
David Robinson.

	Easy! His college ball was played at Navy.
